column2: I am signing this because we need DISNEY TO RE-HIRE JOHNNY DEPP BACK AS our CAPTAIN JACK SPARROW AS OUR FAVORITE PIRATE
column26: Get Disney To Re-hire Johnny Depp
column33: The Walt Disney Company: Get Disney To Re-hire Johnny Depp
column34:
A few years ago , Amber Heard, then wife of Johnny Depp, came out and publicly accused Johnny of physical abuse. This controversy soon lead to a lot of hate being generated towards Johnny and subsequently resulted in him being fired by Disney from his most famous role as Jack Sparrow. In light of recent events, it has been revealed that Johnny Depp was framed by his ex-wife, Amber Heard, as it was in fact herself who was the abuser. During Depp's lawsuit, he he held many accounts of physical abuse against her. One instance consisted of Heard shattering Depp's fingertip with a vodka glass, to the point where he had to get it surgically fixed.

Some same instances of controversy have happened before in relation to Disney. Only a year or so ago, director James Gunn was fired for his disrespectful tweets and yet Disney found it within themselves to re-hire him after he apologised. By that logic, Depp should definitely be re-hired as he committed no crime in the first place, but was in fact a victim of mental and physical abuse.
column36: Get Disney To Re-hire Johnny Depp

column2:
There is no Pirates of the Caribbean without Captain Jack Sparrow. Johnny Depp is the one who carried the franchise. Without him there is nothing. Also, that whole crapfest about Margot Robbie stating that PotC 6 would be all about politics and girl power is an instant "NO THANKS" from me. First off she's a mediocre actress at best who is best left in a supporting role; she just isn't main star material. Second I've had it with all the woke political nonsense and "white man bad".

So keep your 'girl power' political nonsense on Twitter as you won't get any money from me with such nonsense. I want to watch movies to escape from this crap; I don't watch movies to get it shoved down my throat even more.

So bring back Johnny Depp as he's the only one who can save your franchise. Amber Heard was the abuser in that relationship and we already have all the evidence. Yet she keeps getting jobs and just laughing in Johnny's face while he is dropped from everything... just because Disney is scared of a couple soyboys and some blue haired shemales on Twitter? Pathetic.

column2: Johnny was unfairly judged by society on the basis that a women certainly couldnt have beat him up. We need to change this stigma! Women want equal rights but dont want to face the music/punishment when they are found out! #bycottmetoo #boycottamberheard #boycottloreal #boycottaquaman
column22: I have Spina Bifida and am fighting for the rights of the disabled to marry without being penalized. Im fighting for us to have the same rights as everyone else because those of us who are disabled want the best life we can live without discrimination.

column33: The Walt Disney Company: Get Disney To Re-hire Johnny Depp
column34:
A few years ago , Amber Heard, then wife of Johnny Depp, came out and publicly accused Johnny of physical abuse. This controversy soon lead to a lot of hate being generated towards Johnny and subsequently resulted in him being fired by Disney from his most famous role as Jack Sparrow. In light of recent events, it has been revealed that Johnny Depp was framed by his ex-wife, Amber Heard, as it was in fact herself who was the abuser. During Depp's lawsuit, he he held many accounts of physical abuse against her. One instance consisted of Heard shattering Depp's fingertip with a vodka glass, to the point where he had to get it surgically fixed.

Some same instances of controversy have happened before in relation to Disney. Only a year or so ago, director James Gunn was fired for his disrespectful tweets and yet Disney found it within themselves to re-hire him after he apologised. By that logic, Depp should definitely be re-hired as he committed no crime in the first place, but was in fact a victim of mental and physical abuse.
